metadata.dc:author: Martínez Ross, E
metadata.dc:description: A battery of four tests was applied to determine what personality traits prevailed in a group of 48 Mexican odontologists. It was found that aggressiveness, anxiety, insecurity and obsessiveness occupy a prominent place in their psychological profile. The author recommends prophylactic psychotherapy as a means of searching for equilibrium in professional life.
metadata.dc:title: La búsqueda del equilibrio: agresión y otros rasgos de carácter en el odontólogo mexicano.
[The search for equilibrium: aggression and other character traits in Mexican dentists].
